column1: Monthly-mean zonal mean 2-d atmosphere or land surface data (latitude, pressure, time:month) Provide output interpolated to fixed pressure levels at:

column10: (interpolate first each column to fixed pressure levels, then calculate zonal mean; take into account missing values)

column2: Long_name
Zonal Mean Air Temperature

Zonal Mean Mean Age of Stratospheric Air
column10: The mean age of air is defined as the mean time that a stratospheric air mass has been out of contact with the well-mixed troposphere.

column2: Zonal Mean CH3Cl Volume Mixing Ratio
Zonal Mean CH3CCl3 Volume Mixing Ratio
Zonal Mean CCl4 Volume Mixing Ratio
Zonal Mean CFCl3 Volume Mixing Ratio
Zonal Mean CF2Cl2 Volume Mixing Ratio
Zonal Mean CHClF2 Volume Mixing Ratio
Zonal Mean CH3CCl2F Volume Mixing Ratio
Zonal Mean CH3CClF2 Volume Mixing Ratio
Zonal mean CBrClF2 Volume Mixing Ratio
Zonal Mean CBrF3 Volume Mixing Ratio
Zonal Mean CBrF2CBrF2 Volume Mixing Ratio
Zonal Mean CH3Br Volume Mixing Ratio
Zonal Mean CH2Br2 Volume Mixing Ratio
Zonal mean CHBr3 Volume Mixing Ratio
Zonal Mean HNO3 Volume Mixing Ratio
Zonal mean HCl Volume Mixing Ratio
Zonal Mean ClONO2 Volume Mixing Ratio
Zonal Mean Total Reactive Nitrogen (NOy) Volume Mixing Ratio
column10: Total reactive nitrogen; usually includes atomic nitrogen (N), nitric oxide (NO), NO2, nitrogen trioxide (NO3), dinitrogen radical (N2O5), nitric acid (HNO3), peroxynitric acid (HNO4), BrONO2, ClONO2.  Add comment attribute with detailed description about how the model calculates these fields e.g. NOy = N + NO + NO2 + NO3 + HNO3 + 2N2O5 + HNO4 + ClONO2 + BrONO2

column2: Zonal Mean Total Inorganic Chlorine (Cly) Volume Mixing Ratio
column10: Total inorganic stratospheric chlorine (e.g., HCl, ClO) resulting from degradation of chlorine-containing source gases (CFCs, HCFCs, VSLS), and natural inorganic chlorine sources (e.g., sea salt and other aerosols).  Add comment attribute with detailed description about how the model calculates these fields e.g. Cly = HCl + ClONO2 + HOCl + ClO + Cl + 2*Cl2O2 +2Cl2 + OClO + BrCl

column2: Zonal Mean Total Inorganic Bromine (Bry) Volume Mixing Ratio
column10: Total inorganic bromine (e.g., HBr and inorganic bromine oxides and radicals (e.g., BrO, atomic bromine (Br), bromine nitrate (BrONO2)) resulting from degradation of bromine-containing organic source gases (halons, methyl bromide, VSLS), and natural inorganic bromine sources (e.g., volcanoes, sea salt, and other aerosols).  Add comment attribute with detailed description about how the model calculates these fields e.g. Bry = Br + BrO + HOBr + HBr + BrONO2 + BrCl.

Northward EPF
column10: Transformed Eulerian Mean Diagnostics Meridional component Fy of EP-flux (Fy, Fz) derived from 6hr or higher frequency fields (use daily fields or 12 hr fields if the 6 hr are not available).  Please use the definitions given by equation 3.5.3a of Andrews, Holton and Leovy text book.

column2: Upward EPF
column10: Transformed Eulerian Mean Diagnostics Meridional component Fz of EP-flux (Fy, Fz) derived from 6hr or higher frequency fields (use daily fields or 12 hr fields if the 6 hr are not available).  Please use the definitions given by equation 3.5.3b of Andrews, Holton and Leovy text book.

column2: Tendency of Eastward Wind from EPF Divergence
column10: Transformed Eulerian Mean Diagnostics Acceleration from the EP-flux divergence (D) derived from 6hr or higher frequency fields (use daily fields or 12 hr fields if the 6 hr are not available).  Please use the definitions given by equation 3.5.2a of Andrews, Holton and Leovy text book.

column2: Northward TEM air velocity
column10: Transformed Eulerian Mean Diagnostics v*, meridional component of the residual meridional circulation (v*, w*) derived from 6 hr or higher frequency data fields (use instantaneous daily fields or 12 hr fields if the 6 hr data are not available).

column2: Upward TEM air velocity
column10: Transformed Eulerian Mean Diagnostics w*, meridional component of the residual meridional circulation (v*, w*) derived from 6 hr or higher frequency data fields (use instantaneous daily fields or 12 hr fields if the 6 hr data are not available). Scale height: 6950 m

column2: Tendency of Eastward Wind from GWD
column10: Eastward acceleration from the total (orographic + non-orographic) parameterized gravity wave drag (GWD) derived either from daily means or 6hr fields (use instantaneous daily fields or 12 hr fields if the 6 hr data are not available). Use the accelerations as applied in your model.

column2: Tendency of Eastward Wind from OGWD
column10: Eastward acceleration from the parameterized orographic gravity wave drag (OGWD) derived either from daily means or 6hr fields (use instantaneous daily fields or 12 hr fields if the 6 hr data are not available). Use the accelerations as applied in your model.

Zonal orographic gravity wave stress (momentum flux), including any flux out of the top of the model (e.g., add additional level to the output file for model top. Set flux at this level to zero if nothing escapes to outer space in your model), derived either from daily means or 6hr fields (use instantaneous daily fields or 12 hr fields if the 6 hr data are not available).

column2: Tendency of Eastward Wind from Non-OGWD
column10: Eastward acceleration from the parameterized non-orographic gravity wave drag (NOGWD) derived either from daily means or 6hr fields (use instantaneous daily fields or 12 hr fields if the 6 hr data are not available). Use the accelerations as applied in your model.

Westward component of the zonal non-orographic gravity wave momentum flux, including any flux out of the top of the model (e.g., add additional level to the output file for model top. Set flux at this level to zero if nothing escapes to outer space in your model), derived either from daily means or 6hr fields (use instantaneous daily fields or 12 hr fields if the 6 hr data are not available).

Eastward component of the zonal non-orographic gravity wave momentum flux, including any flux out of the top of the model (e.g., add additional level to the output file for model top. Set flux at this level to zero if nothing escapes to outer space in your model), derived either from daily means or 6hr fields (use instantaneous daily fields or 12 hr fields if the 6 hr data are not available).

Other sub-grid scale/numerical zonal drag excluding that already provided for the parameterized orographic and non-ororgraphic gravity waves. This would be used to calculate the total 'diabatic drag'. Contributions to this additional drag such Rayleigh friction and diffusion that can be calculated from the monthly mean wind fields should not be included, but details (e.g. coefficients) of the friction and/or diffusion used in the model should be provided separately.

column2: Zonal Mean CH2O Volume Mixing Ratio
Zonal Mean CH3OOH Volume Mixing Ratio
Zonal Mean CO Volume Mixing Ratio
Zonal Mean Diabatic Heating Rates
column10: The diabatic heating rates due to all the processes that may change potential temperature
